name: Erdős–Faber–Lovász conjecture
rephrased: If a graph is formed by overlapping complete graphs (cliques) of size n, with each clique containing n vertices and any two cliques sharing at most one vertex, then the entire graph can be colored using only n colors.
implication_form: If a graph is the union of n complete subgraphs, each having exactly n vertices, and every pair of these complete subgraphs shares at most one common vertex, then the chromatic number of the graph is at most n.
posed_by: Paul Erdős, Zdeněk Faber, and Ágnes Szendrei (commonly known as Lovász)
explained: The Erdős–Faber–Lovász conjecture states that if a graph G is the union of n complete subgraphs (cliques), each containing exactly n vertices, and any two of these cliques share at most one vertex, then the chromatic number χ(G) is at most n.
related_conjectures: Conjectures on the chromatic index of linear hypergraphs
